dcterms:description: SimDial is a multi-domain dialog generator that can generate realistic conversations for slot-filling domains with configurable complexity. It simulates communication noise and generates long dialogs with error recovery strategies, making it a challenging dataset for evaluating generative end-to-end dialog models.
dcterms:title: SimDial

dcterms:creator: Mihail Eric
Christopher D Manning
dcterms:description: The Stanford Multi-Domain Dialog (SMD) dataset consists of 3031 human-human dialogs across three domains: weather, navigation, and scheduling. It is used to validate the generalization of proposed methods to human-generated dialogs.
dcterms:title: Stanford Multi-Domain Dialog (SMD) dataset
